description.title: Find It
description.description: Find and collect possible hazards to prevent the environmental damage!

participant.lost: You have unfortunately not found a dangerous object for too long, which has now caused a damage. You have lost, please try again.

tutorial.click: Click on any spot in the scene to get a list of placeable objects.
tutorial.place: Choose one of those objects to place it.
tutorial.move: Move the object by drag and drop
tutorial.rotate: Rotate, scale and delete the selected object by using the toolbar button
tutorial.info: This scene is not as harmless as it might seem!
tutorial.hazards: Scattered throughout these scene are dangerous hazards.
tutorial.collect: Collect them by clicking on them and prevent a massive disaster before it is too late!
tutorial.magnifier: Use the magnifying glass to look behind the objects.

cigarette.name: Cigarette
cigarette.description: Cigarettes which haven't been extinguished properly are one of the most severe fire hazards out there. They get thrown out of cars or get left behind by hikers on their way to the top.

campfire.name: Campfire
campfire.description: Campfires can be rekindled by the wind, causing a forest fire.

turtle.name: Turtles
turtle.description: Turtles do not occur naturally in our area. Exposed in the forest, they are defenseless.

bug.name: Bugs
bug.description: Beetles are part of the natural ecosystem, form the basis of the food chain for other animals and loosen the soil. Their survival is therefore important for the survival of the forest and other animals.

bottle.name: Glass Bottle
bottle.description: It is a myth that left-behind glass bottles of all kinds act like a lens under the right circumstances and focus the light. No one can start a fire at the focal point! However, garbage does not belong in the forest, as animals can get hurt.

fish.name: Fish
fish.description: Fishen can be stranded after the flood and need to be rescued.

garbage.name: Garbage
garbage.description: Garbage can be carried away by the flood and must be collected again later.

turtle.name: Turtles
turtle.description: Turtles do not occur naturally in our area. Exposed in the forest, they are defenseless.

bug.name: Bugs
bug.description: Beetles are part of the natural ecosystem, form the basis of the food chain for other animals and loosen the soil. Their survival is therefore important for the survival of the forest and other animals.

statistic.level: How many times was which level played?
statistic.rating: How many times how many points were scored?
statistic.play: How often has which user played a level?
statistic.build: How often has which user created a level?
statistic.time: How many seconds did it take to finish the level?

item.play: How often was which item found?
item.build: How often was which item hidden?
